utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: It's Tom.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Tom, your husband? What's he doing here?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Uh, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I know I'm not supposed to be here, but Evelyn's school contract's due tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: I knew I was forgetting something. Let me, uh, find a pen.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Not quite sure what Emily Post recommends in this situation, but I'm Tom.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Damien.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Sorry to intrude. I just—I wasn't quite sure when she'd be coming home.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Thank you so much for catching this. .

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, I'll get out of your way, it was good to meet you, and I'll see you later, hon. .

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: So… seems like a nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Jules, you okay?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: No, my stomach.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Here. Lie down.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Try to—

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Get Tom. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Tom!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know what would be perfect?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: French toast tower.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: You still go to Mickey's? What's your cholesterol?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's my one vice. I'm keeping it.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: As much as I would love to clog my arteries, I have a 10 o’clock CT and I still have to race home, get changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's just trying to get into your skirts. And I don't mean metaphorically.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Well, he's got the legs for it. So I will see you tonight?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Bye, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have a nice day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said I'd stay out of it. .

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Clearly, SOMETHING.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, on a list of your attributes, there's nothing that even rhymes with "coy."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, I may have seen something in the fridge. Like the end of your relationship. She put the milk in the door and not on the shelf.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You hate that she did that, but you didn't say anything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're trying to get us to fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I'm trying to help. If you got an issue, let her know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I should have known that you weren't done sabotaging this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Stew in your irritation. And sure, last time it bubbled over into resentment and rage, leading ultimately to a painful divorce that neither of you ever really recovered from, but I'm sure this time it'll be great.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Interesting case. 35-year-old woman with fever and abdominal pain. E.R. ruled out all the usual suspects.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And she's in an open marriage.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Animals also eat their young and kill their rivals. That make it weird that most of us don't?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Says the guy whose opposable thumbs have been all over how many women who aren't his wife?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Our patient's unhappy because she's suffering from an intestinal blockage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boring. Then we have to find a reason to rule it out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about herpes colitis? She picks up the infection from one of her partners. It takes root in her colon.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: STD panel was clean.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Chances are, this couple was unhappy in the first place. This is their attempt to save something that never— . Go on.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Herpes might not register if she was exposed in the last six weeks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But it would show up on a barium enema.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wait. You're gonna do it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Barium coats the inner lining of your colon. Lets us get a good look at it on the X-ray.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: I can get somebody else to pick up Evelyn. I feel like I'm abandoning you.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: I'm on painkillers. I'd rather this not be what you think of every time you look at my butt. .

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, roll onto your side. It's fill 'er up time. So is Evelyn his new squeeze?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: She's our daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Must be interesting growing up in a production of Oh! Calcutta!

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: She's six. She knows as much about our sex life as any other kid her age.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can explain that she's the reason the two of you stayed married.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: You've been in the room five minutes. You got us all figured out. Of course, you left out the part where we love each other and we want to grow old together.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you just don't want to be young together.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tank's full. I'll page the radiology elves.

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: I'm not saying I hate it. Just doesn't go with your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You hate it.

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: Little bit.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Any more heartless critiques of my general appearance?

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: Nope. All done.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Maya and I are just friends.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, you and I are friends and you don't have coffee with me three times a week.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's an interesting person. She grew up in Ohio. She has three brothers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Fascinating. Last week, that Cambodian lab tech was telling us how he survived the Killing Fields and you left to go get a donut.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So we flirt. It's fun.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's dangerous. That woman would totally do you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: All I'm saying is if you want to be on a diet, you might want to stop hanging out by the dessert cart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It stopped hurting during the X-ray, which means it was just an intestinal blockage that passed. We should discharge her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely. There's no need to find any underlying cause 'cause these things never happen twice. Take her digestive system for a test drive. Give her a radio-opaque milkshake. X-ray every 15 minutes to see if it makes any unscheduled stops on the way through.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll be here all night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, Taub will be here all night. Talk to the unicorn and then tell me you don't believe. .

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I did an abdominal CT on a kid today and found a six-inch bezoar made entirely of gum. I mean, who gives a three-year-old an endless supply of g— You okay?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I mean, there was hair in it and maybe a piece of paper.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So… how long you been married?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: One of the few drawbacks of having an open marriage. Nobody ever asks me about current events or the weather.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yankees look good this season.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And, uh, how long have you – you know?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: After three years, we realized that traditional marriage was making us both miserable.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Most people get divorced at that point.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Yeah, we didn't want to get divorced. We still loved each other. We just realized that expecting one person to fulfill all of your needs forever is unrealistic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are happy monogamous couples out there.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Sure. One or two have the perfect marriage. Everybody else has figured out how to settle for less. I don't want to settle and end up resenting my husband. I'd rather get the 10% he doesn't give me somewhere else so that I can really appreciate him for the 90% he does. . I think something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: With your stomach?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: My heart is racing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Try to take deep breaths. I'm going to try to slow your heart down.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Is this because of the blockage?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. It's not working. Need a crash cart in here!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need a list of all your sexual partners from the last six months.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your wife had an arrhythmia. The progression of symptoms from bowel to heart makes a parasitic infection most likely. Since Julia hasn't been out of the country—

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: The only place that I've been recently is a business trip to Nebraska.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But either of you could have picked up a bug from one of your partners.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: It's kind of… complicated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How many partners are we talking about? Ballpark.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So why not just tell her that and close this whole thing up?

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: You married?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I – I was.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Did you ever agree to go see a chick flick with your wife or pretend to enjoy classical music?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Stravinsky never groped my wife in a midtown hotel room.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: She needs this. I don't. But I don't want her to feel bad about that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Guy's got a license to drill. Why would he lie about not using it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not the lie. The lie is that he gives a crap about how his wife feels. If they're both screwing around, that's one thing. But if she has a piece on the side and he doesn't, the only way he'd be okay with that is if he's betraying her in some other way that, in his mind, makes them even. My unicorn isn't a unicorn. It's a donkey with a plunger stuck to its face.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Right. Even the guy who's not cheating is doing it for underhanded reasons.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, no, no. He's not being cynical. He's assuming the husband is doing something to even the score, which means he thinks there is a score, which means, cheating swans aside, House believes in monogamy. He's being romantic. .

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What I believe is that men are genetically engineered to be jealous. Doesn't matter if I think there's a score. I guarantee you he does. Any of the wife's partners pan out?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's been with two people other than Tom in the last six months. Neither of them have been outside the tri-state area.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we're back to the husband.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You just said you believed—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's doing something behind her back. What better cover than a business trip to Nebraska? Like that's really a place.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Let's find his travel records and get back to work.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You seem pretty mellow about this couple's deal. Thought you'd be first in line to shake a finger.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They're still married. I'm not. Not that I could ever do it. I was jealous of House and Cameron never touched him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not counting the emotional fondling. . When my mom was dying, my dad had an affair.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He told you this?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'd seen them get out of his car. Two years after mom died, they got married.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That must have sucked.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: At the time, yeah. But looking back… It makes sense. My mom never knew about it and he needed someone to make him feel less alone. He took care of my mom day in and day out for two and a half years before she died. He was devoted to her. Loving someone else didn't change that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So loving two people at once is fine as long as one of them is dying?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Whoever's taking care of me when I get sick, I hope they've got someone else to take care of them.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Tom was telling the truth. He really did go to Nebraska. Plane ticket and restaurant seats.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Forget Nebraska. . Maybe they just bought their parasites at the mall.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You know, we should really throw away that loofah. They're imported. Sometimes they're not sterilized. We think our patient got amoebiasis from hers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is she gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We're treating now. She should be fine. It's actually kind of bizarre. She and her husband have an open marriage.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They sleep with other people?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, she does. Her husband's totally fine with it. I mean, it's crazy, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you're bringing this up because?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought it was interesting.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: More interesting than your other cases, I guess. I mean, you talk about your colleagues, you rant about House. You don't usually mention your patients. Is open marriage something you want?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. I mean… I know you'd never…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay. There's a woman at work. People say she's attracted to me, but nothing's happened. Nothing's going to happen. I'm not having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But you want to.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, honey. I'm trying to be honest. I don't want to make the same mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Be honest then. Are you attracted to her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Look… she's attractive. There's an attraction. Aren't there men who make you feel that way?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course there are, but it never occurs to me to act on it because- because I'm married… to you. And that's enough for me. Aren't I enough for you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Of course you are. Our patient's lost all movement in her legs.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There are other doctors, Chris. We're talking.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry. The woman's paralyzed. I'll get a cab.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tests show no spinal cord injury, no cerebral lesions, no hemorrhage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Finally got a stool sample. The loofah's innocent. No sign of amoebas or any other parasites.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So paralysis, arrhythmia, and intermittent abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And he nicked himself shaving. Sorry. That was Taub. But it was easier to solve. Means he used the crappy razor in his locker, which means he slept here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thanks to you. I brought up open marriage with Rachel. It was a disaster.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On the medical front, we've knocked out sex and foreign travel. Could be an electrolyte imbalance.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So the only time you're not interested in my marriage is after you blow it up?

utterance.speaker: Houses
utterance.content: You're the moron who took marital advice from Tila Tequila.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You pushed me into this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Figured it would either blow up your marriage or make it more honest. Either way, you win.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We've ruled out sex.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We ruled out sex with other people. Tom said he and Julia have been doing it three or four times a week and she's got boys on the side.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Increased libido can be a symptom of adrenocortical carcinoma, which also explains her other symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just because everybody in this room wishes that all women were horny all the time doesn't make it so. Get an MRI of her adrenal glands.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Hi. Okay if I take the sports page?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Would you mind using a coaster?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Oh. Sure. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's okay. . Also, it'd be great if you'd replace the toilet paper when you finish a roll. And when you load the dishwasher, you can't put a big, flat bowl on the bottom. . It traps the water so nothing on the top gets clean. And please don't throw banana peels in the bedroom trash.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I haven't done any of those things.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're probably not even aware of—

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I hate bananas.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Why would he think that stuff would make us fight?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because of the milk. You put it in the door. The body of the refrigerator is the coldest part. The temperature in the door fluctuates, which decreases shelf life.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just want clean dishes and unspoiled milk so we can all stay healthy.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Oh, it's about health. What about the coaster? Does that replenish my B-12 or something?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Can we just drop it?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Sure. . You have this list of annoyances the entire time we were married?

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Get better, mommy.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: I love you, rabbit. .

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Julia, you have a guest.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Dr. Hadley, did you say there was a video game in the playroom?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: See you in radiology.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Get out of my wife's room. Your relationship with her stays out of our space.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: I was worried about her.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Tom's right. You should go.

utterance.speaker: Damien
utterance.content: So it's fine if we have sex, but if I drop by to see if you're okay—

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: How hard is it to ask me not to put them in the dryer? And I only did your laundry because you were never home.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't ask you to.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Of course you didn't. You just got annoyed whenever you didn't have clean underwear.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I never said I was annoyed.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: That's the point. You didn't say anything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Conversation sort of got away from me. It was a train wreck.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think it's good you brought it up. I read a study that found men who have multiple copies of a certain vasopressin receptor are twice as likely to be unfaithful. Maybe you're just one of those guys.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So my cheating is biologically predetermined? . Fantastic.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Multiply times five. We need a better look at the medulla. I thought you'd be relieved. This gets you off the hook. It's just genetics.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's because being short and bald doesn't hurt anybody.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There's nothing there. It's not adrenal cancer. And maybe you're right about me. But I'm not gonna stop trying. Rachel's worth it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You served me with divorce papers in the middle of a medical conference in New Orleans . I threw a bottle into an antique mirror.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Oh, you exhibited an emotion? I wish I'd known you were capable.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I loved you. I thought I was gonna be following you to Baltimore, remember? . I called about apartments. I set up interviews.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe because I was working two jobs to support us.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was killing myself so that you could take that non-paying internship—

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Expressing yourself does not make you the bad guy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: VQ scan confirmed the spot on Julia's lung was a clot.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If he has a secret, I highly doubt it's more relevant than the clot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clotting disorder would explain everything. Question is, which one?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Do you read any of your departmental memos?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only the ones labeled, "n-s-f-w."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, that's "n-n-s-f-w."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I'm long past the number of procedures that'll bankrupt them.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Julia's got insurance. I saw the policy number on the form.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But the policy lapsed due to non-payment. I already made three calls about this. You should have been aware of that.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Why the retirement account?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll just give you a few minutes to— .

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By "we," she means "she." .

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: I lost all of our savings.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen enters
utterance.content: I started her on heparin to prevent further clots, but we still don't know what's going on.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's not medically relevant. You're not gonna care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson's been teaching me how to care. Try me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He builds wind turbines and leases them out to local power companies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. I don't care. . Clotting disorder: DIC. Factor five leiden, antiphospholipid syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Vitamin K deficiency also fits. Causes thrombophilia and is consistent with abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Congratulations, House. Sam ended it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go test our patient's blood…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But it can wait five minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: … for everything we discussed. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Or you could have stayed out of it. I could have kept my mouth shut, been annoyed sometimes, but I'd be happy, because I'd still be with her. . Now all I have is cold milk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As long as you're free, you want to grab some dinner?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Did Tom go home for the night?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: For starters. I told him to leave. I don't want him here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Money is a complicated subject.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Yeah, it's not the money. I mean, the — the money's bad, but… When we first opened our marriage, I got involved with a guy who lied about being single. Then one day, his wife calls me. She's crying and screaming and totally out of control. And I felt… superior. I thought I don't ever have to worry about feeling this way because Tom and I are honest with each other. Well, here I am.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hi. Sorry I didn't make it home last night. I needed to run some tests.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I told you nothing's going—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are you giving me permission to sleep with other women?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I want you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tomorrow's Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: All our tests came back negative. It's not a clotting disorder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means we need to come up with a better idea. So what causes problems in the stomach, heart, nerves? .

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know what it is?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mazel Tov?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No sign of schistocytes or hemolysis. So you're actually going to sleep with another woman then go home to your wife?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank God someone's keeping us focused on what's really important.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Taub was gonna do all of that anyway. Pulmonary arterial hypertension.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Imaging showed normal diameter in her pulmonary artery. Here's a thought — Taub's wife is now totally on the market. Mind hitting me with her digits?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She would love that, but duty calls.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: My stomach.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Same pain as before?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Yeah, but worse.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get the portable ultrasound in here. We need to get a look at her belly.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pain, pain went away, came back another day. Question is, what brought it back?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Physical exam was unrevealing. Ultrasound was clean.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient. Abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, he's right. Let's get this wrapped up before 6. Taub turns back into a faithful pumpkin at midnight.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because lying alone in a hospital bed contemplating bankruptcy — hot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My point was that arousal is a function of the parasympathetic nervous system. If that's where the problem is, the pain could be triggered by crying, which seems—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: PNS also controls digestion, which she's been doing without screaming her head off since she's been here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What if what matters isn't when the pain started, but when it stopped?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It was during an X-ray. You think that cured her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, but House prepped her for the X-ray with a barium enema.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, that wouldn't treat anything except—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're in pain because part of your intestine folded in on itself. It's called an intussusception.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's cutting off blood flow. We need to fix it before your bowel gets necrotic and dies.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Once you do that, will I get better?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When this happens in adults, it's usually a sign of abdominal cancer. We'll fix the overlap, and then search your intestine for tumors.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foam?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have a bad feeling about this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. That's the beauty. I genuinely tried to help Wilson. I told him to stand up for himself, which you know is legitimate advice. And his relationship blew up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So you're paying it forward?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If this should somehow lead to Lucas dying or oral sex, so be it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Think I should wear a tie tonight?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This isn't weird at all. I mean, where's Rachel eating tonight?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Home.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if she's going out too? She is allowed to, right?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Of course. It's only fair. But I don't think she will.

utterance.speaker: Operating Nurse
utterance.content: Your wife only eats dinner at home?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If she did go out, that would be tough, but I think I can handle it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't do it unless you're sure.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know I'd rather be jealous than a liar. Got something here. Kelly clamp and scalpel.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Biopsy showed non-specific inflammation, which suggests IBD, only it doesn't explain the cardiac problems.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or her declining kidney function. We ran panels during surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, IBD does make sense, 'cause it could trigger ankylosing spondylitis, which would explain the heart and the kidneys. Start her on sulfasalazine and TNF inhibitors. Oh, and Taub, I'm not gonna see you before you head off for Gomorrah. Just remember, if you get disoriented… breathe through your nose and look for the horizon.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing's happened. It's okay.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. I've been an idiot, and I don't need anything else. I just need you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You mean that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I do. I love you, Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I love you too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let's go home.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are other doctors. .

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The treatment's not working. Her left kidney failed last night. The other one's right behind it. It's not ankylosing spondylitis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kidney biopsy showed she had IgA nephropathy, which could be caused by or associated with any of these conditions.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We've gone from too few ideas to too many, and our patient's running out of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why the lack of afterglow? Physio girl not as freaky as you'd hoped?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I went home with my wife.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can't hurt Rachel like that. Sickle cell anemia would have shown on blood tests. No flattened intestinal villi rules out celiac. Seriously? Our patient's dying, and we can't move past my sex life?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seriously, you'd think it'd kill her if we spend 15 seconds mocking you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Alport and anti-GbM antibody are both untreatable, so if she has them we can't help her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And it can't be Henoch-Schonlein purpura. No inciting respiratory infection and no rash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care what it's not. I want to know what it could be.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Well, everything left on the list.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hemochromatosis is a possibility. Excess iron builds up, causes problems throughout the body.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Weil's syndrome also affects multiple organ systems, and it wouldn't have been treated by the antibiotic the E.R. gave her.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis makes sense too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. Treat for those three.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think you should call Tom.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Am I gonna die?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: If he walked in here right now, I'd look in his face and all I would think is "liar".

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don't you think that's kind of unfair? You say honesty's all-important, but you conveniently ignore the truth that some truths hurt people. Tom lied to protect you.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: He was covering his ass.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm not talking about the money. Tom hasn't slept with anyone else in over a year.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: He told you that? So my entire marriage is a sham?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. Your husband, who only wants you, lied so that you could be happy. That seems pretty real to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Me too. I shouldn't have said—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm trying. I always thought that I was keeping the peace, but I was just resenting you and giving you a reason to leave.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I wish we had this fight ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Is it okay if we don't give House the credit?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Oh, I recommend it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: "O" for three. Her kidney function is still declining. We're gonna need to start dialysis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Glad the husband's back. After missing so many little deaths, he should be here for the big one. Top six, anyone?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Polyarteritis nodosa?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'd have seen some improvement on prednisone. Guy's wife's dying, and he stops to buy flowers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: They're from his garden. Mercury poisoning fits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those are lilacs. My mom used to grow lilacs. My dad made her get rid of them, 'cause there were too many bees. We ruled out HSP 'cause there was no inciting respiratory infection. But in rare cases, it can also be triggered by a bee sting.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We also ruled it out because there's no rash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe we just didn't see it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you been stung by a bee recently?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Uh, about a month ago.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not that you know of. Okay, I'm gonna have to check your holes. I'll start with the mouth. If there's nothing there, then things might have to get kinky. Say aah.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Aah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was kinda hoping for kinky.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Is that good or bad?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll treat her with high-dose IVIG and cyclophosphamide. You should be fine.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: I'm gonna be okay. I love you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is adorable. Other than you still wanting to have sex with other dudes, and him bankrupting your family, I think you kids are pretty much home free.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Mm-hmm?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You two made up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can thank me later.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I'm all-in.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You need a hand?

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry about canceling the other night.

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Maya
utterance.content: You wanna go somewhere?
